members.name: Sam Woodwell
bio: Void Walker is the storm at the center of Thunder Born – a redeemed-but-dangerous former pawn of Erevos who now leads a smaller, sharper anti-hero squad.
In the Prime universe, he carries the guilt of his Melcornia corruption and the Bludbruhs fall, trying to aim his lightning and void-touched power at Zion City’s real monsters instead of its heroes.
history: Survived the Melcornia mansion incident and Erevos’s corruption
Led the original Bludbruhs before the schism
Rejected the Enlightened and rebranded his remnant as Thunder Born
First major post-corruption clash was against the Titans as 'Evil Sam'
Now operates on the edges of Parliament jurisdiction as a volatile ally
members.notes: Lightning is his core combat power; telekinesis and emotional influence are lingering Maw/Enlightened scars he actively tries not to abuse.

members.name: Cole
bio: Cruiser is the hammer of Thunder Born – the one who goes in first and leaves dents in everything that shouldn’t be standing.
Where Sam brings electricity and drama, Cole brings momentum and stubborn, grounded loyalty.
history: Early ally of Sam and the pre-Parliament crew
Core frontline member of the Bludbruhs
Chose to stay with Sam during the split instead of following those who joined the Monke Alliance
Helped define Thunder Born’s close-range, shock-and-awe combat style
members.notes: When Sam’s plans get too abstract or mystical, Cole is the one who says, 'Point me at what needs punching.'

members.name: Taylor
bio: Stellar is Thunder Born’s cosmic-flavored gunner, anchoring their chaos with precise long-range fire and battlefield awareness.
While others wade into the storm, he draws constellations of tracer fire across the sky to keep them alive.
history: Joined late Bludbruhs operations as a ranged specialist
Stayed with Sam’s side through the rebranding into Thunder Born
Provides overwatch on high-risk missions where Parliament support is absent
members.notes: Visually and thematically pairs well with Sam’s storm aesthetic, like stars flickering inside a thunderhead.

members.name: James
abilities: Advanced battlefield awareness and intel gathering
Synergy with Void Walker’s lightning in ambushes

faction_connections: Titan/Eclipse adjacent through family ties (Prime canon)

bio: Shadowmind is the quiet one with a brain like a dark room full of red strings.
He scouts, listens, and sets the board so that when Thunder Born hits, they hit where it hurts.
history: Part of the friend-group that preceded Bludbruhs and Thunder Born
Handled recon and stealth operations for the Bludbruhs
Stayed loyal to Sam after the Monke Alliance split, but watches his choices carefully
members.notes: If Sam is the storm and Cole is the hammer, Shadowmind is the whisper before the thunder.

members.name: Tanner
abilities: Enhanced strength and aggression in combat
Synergistic boosts when fighting alongside his 'pack'
bio: Wolff is the pack-instinct of Thunder Born – a feral, loyal enforcer who sinks his teeth into the worst fights and refuses to let go.
His whole vibe is: Sam points, Wolff hunts.
history: Ran with the crew pre-Parliament and pre-Bludbruhs
Witnessed the Melcornia fallout and Sam’s corruption
Chose to stay with Sam’s side rather than leave to the Monke Alliance
Became one of the core faces of the Thunder Born rebrand
members.notes: Emotionally, he sees Thunder Born as a pack – Sam, Cole, James, tech support (formerly Joseph), and whoever else earns that trust.

members.name: Adin
abilities: Symbolic link to distant homelands and cultures
bio: Aotearoa is the eyes and heartbeat of the squad, carrying the weight of home and identity into a Zion City that often forgets where its heroes come from.
history: Joined Thunder Born after the Bludbruhs era, post-schism
Helps Thunder Born navigate both urban and off-world environments
Acts as a grounding presence when Sam’s past threatens to pull the team apart
members.notes: Good character to lean on for cultural depth, travel arcs, or missions outside Zion proper.

members.name: Justin Platt
abilities: Strong synergy with woodland or urban cover

faction_connections: Full Thunder Born member in Sam’s universe

bio: In your Prime universe, Echo Wood is first and foremost a Legionaire, but he’s earned enough trust with Sam and the crew to be treated as Thunder Born family on joint missions.
history: Recruited into the Legionaires for his potential and heart
Fought alongside Thunder Born on key operations, earning honorary status
In Sam’s universe, he’s promoted to full Thunder Born member
members.notes: Prime canon: Legionaire with Thunder Born privileges. Pinnacle/Sam universe: straight-up Thunder Born.

members.name: Zack Dustin
abilities: Synergy with Echo Wood in duo-operations

faction_connections: Full Thunder Born member in Sam’s universe

bio: Carved Echo is another Legionaire who drifts into Thunder Born orbit when things get wild enough.
Where Echo Wood reflects and resonates, Carved Echo hits like a sculptor chiseling through the battlefield.
history: Core Legionaires member in Prime universe
Frequently called in for high-risk Thunder Born / Legion joint missions
Recognized as full Thunder Born in Sam’s universe continuity
members.notes: Good lever if you want cross-team episodes where Legionaires and Thunder Born crash into the same storyline.

members.name: Joseph Dresher
abilities: High-end tech engineering and gadget creation
Battlefield drones, turrets, and energy weapons

faction_connections: Parliament of Justice (indirect support before termination)

bio: Technoman was once the brain and toolbox of Sam’s crew – the guy who could build anything out of scrap and a half-charged power cell.
In Prime canon, he is no longer an active member of Thunder Born.
history: Served as the primary tech backbone of the Bludbruhs
Followed Sam into the Thunder Born era and helped define their tech identity
Official Parliament records list his Thunder Born status as 'terminated'
Details of his final mission or betrayal are classified or disputed
members.notes: In-universe, rumors say Joseph either died in a mission gone catastrophically wrong or turned on the team and paid for it. You can lock this down later once Sam’s book is final.
